Class DB

  • java.lang.Object
    • DB

  • public class DB
extends java.lang.Object
    DB establishes a connection to a database, either with default values or values sent through the set methods.

    If you would like to use this code, either alter the default values or set them.

    YOU MUST CALL DB.connectMe() BEFORE YOU CAN USE THE OBJECT CREATED BY THE DEFAULT CONSTRUCTOR.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    %I%, %G%

      • setUserName

        public void setUserName(java.lang.String username)
        Sets the UserName used when connecting to the database.
        Parameters:
        username - The username used when connecting to the database

      • setPassword

        public void setPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Sets the Password used when connecting to the database.

        IMPORTANTE DO NOT USE PLAIN TEXT PASSWORDS WHEN CONNECTING TO THE DATABASE. MySQL has a nifty password generator that will encrypt your password.

        DO NOT USE THE ROOT ACCOUNT IN ANY PROGRAM OR REALLY EVER AT ALL. It is best to disable the root account all together and create users with strict permissions on what they can and can't do.

        For example spiderman here can only access the crawler database, but has SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, DROP priviledges to any table within. Since spiderman only takes commands from the programs he's run in, you are essentially spiderman. (BEWARE H@X0R$)

        Parameters:
        password - The password used when connecting to the database
        See Also:
        How_to_security

      • setHost

        public void setHost(java.lang.String host)
        Sets the SQL host.

        If on the same machine as the server, this should stay localhost.

        If on a different machine, either use the IP or the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN).

        Parameters:
        host - The host of the SQL database
        See Also:
        Addresses, FQDN

      • setPort

        public void setPort(java.lang.String port)
        Sets the port to connect through. Default MySQL is port 3306.

        If you're unsure of the port, but have access to the server I'd suggest running command "sudo netstat -nlpt" or the equivalent.

        Parameters:
        port - The port to connect through
        See Also:
        netstat

      • setDataBase

        public void setDataBase(java.lang.String database)
        Sets the specific database as root for any queries made. Effectively turns: SELECT * FROM database.table WHERE 1; into: SELECT * FROM table WHERE 1;
        Parameters:
        database - The name of the database to be set as root for this connection
        See Also:
        SQL

      • connectMe

        public void connectMe()
        Connects to the server and database with the specified arguements.

        IMPORTANT Must be called in order to use the DB variable created with the default constructor.

        Parameters:
        none -
        See Also:
        SQL
